resources.name: Detailed information on public opinion website

description:
The Directorate-General Development wished to once again commission a poll on the attitudes of Europeans to Development Aid. Compared to the previous wave which was conducted in 2002, the geographical coverage of this latest survey has of course been enlarged to the 10 New Member States. The questionnaire has been modified over time; however, a number of questions are still comparable.
For each theme addressed, our analysis3 looks at the:
• European Union as a whole;
• Individual Member States;
• Socio-demographic variables;
• Other variables which we systematically cross-tabulated with the results for each question including: perceptions of whether the EU helps developing countries (results for Q7), perceptions of whether the national government helps developing countries (results for Q5) and finally, perceptions of the impact of national governmental aid (results for Q9).
#####The results by volumes are distributed as follows:
* Volume A: Countries
* Volume AA: Groups of countries
* Volume A' (AP): Trends
* Volume AA' (AAP): Trends of groups of countries
* Volume B: EU/socio-demographics
* Volume C: Country/socio-demographics
title: Special Eurobarometer 222: Attitudes towards Develoment Aid
name: S410_62_2_EBS222
